title: Cheshunt ‘murder suicide’ victim stabbed to death in front of her two kids ‘screamed for help from balcony’
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A WOMAN in a dressing gown desperately screamed “call 999” from a balcony before she was knifed to death in a “murder suicide”, a neighbour has revealed. 
Two children watched their mum being hacked to death yesterday before the killer — thought to be their dad — turned the blade on himself. @Pawel_Ciejka A man and a woman have died of stabbing injuries at their home in Hertfordshire @Pawel_Ciejka Police arrived on the scene to find the woman dead and a man dying of his wounds @Pawel_Ciejka 3 The incident took place this afternoon in the Turners Hill area of Cheshunt 
Cops with guns and riot shields charged the door of the family’s flat after the nightie-clad mother, 27, ran terrified on to the balcony. 
Neighbour James Coyne told the Hertfordshire Mercury he heard cries for helpn at around 1.15pm, just minutes after showing a prospective lodger around his flat in Leighton Court, Turners Hill, Cheshunt 
Coyne said: “It was shocking. I had heard arguments. The man had been aggressive and I have been worried about it before.“I opened up the window to hear what was going on and then there she was in a bath robe on the balcony. 
“She was screaming out call 999 in my direction. I realised it was pretty serious and I called 999 and they said they had already had a call.” 
But when police arrived, the woman had been butchered and the knifeman was dying. 
The children, a boy and girl thought to be aged five and seven, were unharmed. Man and woman die of stab wounds at their home in Hertfordshire 
Paramedics were seen carrying the man out after an air ambulance landed in Cheshunt, Herts. 
A horrified onlooker said: “They spent about ten minutes trying to revive him. 
"Eventually they put a sheet over him and I knew he was dead.”

Speaking to the Hertfordshire Mercury , local bar manager Peter Prejna said: "I just heard sirens and then the air ambulance landing in the road. 
"I feel sorry for the kids. I heard there were two children in there as well. One was about six, same age as my child." 
Police confirmed the man died at the scene. The witness said: “The woman had come outside wearing just her nightie. 
“There was a lot of screaming coming from inside. 
“I phoned 999. They told me they were already on their way.” HELICOPTER LANDED IN THE STREET pic.twitter.com/m7DUoJJwPl 
— James (@JamesCoyne) February 19, 2017 
A police spokesperson said: "Police were called to Turners Hill in Cheshunt at 1.15pm today following reports of a disturbance within a property. 
"When police arrived at the address they found a woman had been stabbed and had tragically passed away. 
"A man was also found to be at the property with knife wounds. 
"He also tragically passed away shortly after at the scene. 
"At this early stage of the investigation, police do not currently believe they are looking for anyone else in connection with this incident. Investigations are on-going." 
A neighbour said cops had been called to the flat before, adding: “There was always screaming and shouting in there.” 
A spokesman for the inquiry confirmed: “At this early stage, police do not currently believe they are looking for anyone else.” Police cordoned off the area pic.twitter.com/J8wAg2QQxI 
Coyne, who witnessed the arrival of the emergency services, took to Twitter to describe the ordeal as it unfolded. 
He rang for help with cops arriving on the scene shortly after. 
James noticed one of the police officers was equipped with a riot shield and snapped a picture of the helicopter landing in the street outside the building. 
A social media manager by profession, he said he also saw a body being taken away from the flat but told followers he was okay but a little shaken.
